tit.cmt: 用語集ではhanke、hange両方ありますが、初出の規定に沿って直しました。原文にも はんけ となっていますので 以下全部修正しました。

sen.j: 半家（はんけ）とは鎌倉時代以降に成立した公卿の家格で堂上家の中でも最下位の家柄である。
sen.e: Hange is a classification term for the court noble class established subsequent to the Kamakura period being the lowest-ranked family in social standing among Tosho-ke (high court nobility who is allowed to enter the Imperial Palace).

Hange is a classification term for the court noble class established subsequent to the Kamakura period being the lowest-ranked family in social standing among Tosho-ke (high court nobility allowed to enter the Imperial Palace).

Hanke (a kind of family status of the Court nobles) is a classification term for the court noble class established subsequent to the Kamakura period being the lowest-ranked family in social standing among Tosho-ke (high court nobility allowed to enter the Imperial Palace).

sen.j: 専ら本姓以外の氏族を出自とし、特殊な技術を以って朝廷に仕える。
sen.e: Hange invariably came from a clan whose surname was different from their real family name and served the Imperial Court using specific skills.
Hange invariably came from a clan whose surname was different from their real family name and served the Imperial Court using specific skills.
Hanke invariably came from a clan whose surname was different from their real family name and served the Imperial Court using specific skills.

sen.j: 官位に関しては羽林家や名家 (公家)に準じて昇進する。
sen.e: With respect to court ranks, Hange attained promotion at junior level to that of the house of Urin and important noble family.
With respect to court ranks, Hange attained promotion at the junior level to that of the house of Urin and as an important noble family.
With respect to court ranks, Hanke attained promotion at the junior level to that of the house of Urin and as an important noble family.

sen.j: 一部の家は近衛府や弁官を経ないで大納言を極官とするが、公卿となっても非参議に留まるものが多い。
sen.e: Some families advanced to Dainagon (chief councilor of state), the highest post attainable by appointment, without working their way up through Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) or Benkan (Oversight Department: a division of the Dajokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) but, while having joined the ranks of Kugyo (the top court officials), many Hange families tended to stagnate at the level of Hisangi (advisor at large).

Some families advanced to Dainagon (chief councilor of state), the highest post attainable by appointment, without working their way up through Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) or Benkan (Oversight Department: a division of the Dajokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) but, while having joined the ranks of Kugyo (the top court officials), many Hange families tended to stagnate at the level of Hisangi (advisor at large).

Some families advanced to Dainagon (chief councilor of state), the highest post attainable by appointment, without working their way up through Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) or Benkan (Oversight Department: a division of the Dajokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) but, while having joined the ranks of Kugyo (the top court officials), many Hanke families tended to stagnate at the level of Hisangi (advisor at large).

sen.j: 明治維新後は子爵となった。
sen.e: Hange became referred to as viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
Hange became referred to as viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
Hanke became referred to as viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
A List of Hange
A List of Hange
A List of Hanke

sen.j: 高倉家：藤原北家高倉流。
sen.e: The Takakura family: Takakura line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.e: The Nishiki-no-koji family became extinct in the late Sengoku period but was subsequently restored by the child of Yorisuke KOMORI Yoritsune NISHIKINOKOJI in the mid-Edo period.

The Nishiki-no-koji family became extinct during the late Sengoku period, but was subsequently restored by Yoritsune NISHIKINOKOJI, the child of Yorisuke KOMORI, during the mid-Edo period.
sen.cmt: 他の修正にそって、コンマ追加

sen.e: It was an old family.

sen.j: 北小路家：大江匡重の子北小路俊宣が北小路を称した。
sen.e: The Kitakoji family: Toshinobu KITAKOJI, the child of OE no Masashige, started to refer himself to as KITAKOJI.
The Kitakoji family: Toshinobu KITAKOJI, the child of OE no Masashige, started to refer to himself as KITAKOJI.
The Kitakoji family: Toshinobu KITAKOJI, the child of OE no Masashige, started to refer to himself as KITAKOJI.

sen.j: その後江戸時代後期に北小路俊常、及び分家の北小路俊矩が堂上家に列せられた。
sen.e: Toshitsune KITAKOJI and Toshinori KITAKOJI of the branch family were subsequently promoted to join the ranks of Tosho-ke (high court nobility who is allowed to enter the Imperial Palace) in the late Edo period.
